name: Modules.Crypto.Cryptor
summary: The Cryptor object provides access to a number of symmetric encryption algorithms. Symmetric encryption algorithms come in two "flavors" - block ciphers, and stream ciphers. Block ciphers process data (while both encrypting and decrypting) in discrete chunks of data called blocks; stream ciphers operate on arbitrary sized data.

parameters.name: dataIn
parameters.summary: The Titanium.Buffer object containing the data to decrypt

parameters.name: dataInLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes in the dataIn buffer to decrypt. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataIn buffer will be used.

parameters.name: dataOut
parameters.summary:
The Titanium.Buffer object to receive the decrypted data. If this argument is not provided, then the dataIn buffer will be used.

  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to true, then the dataOut buffer will be resized to the size of the decrypted data
  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to false, then ensure that the dataOut buffer is large enough to receive the decrypted data.

parameters.name: dataOutLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes available in the dataOut buffer. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataOut buffer will be used.

returns.summary:
Returns the number of bytes decrypted into the dataOut buffer. If an error occurred, then the return value will be less than zero and will be one of the following values:

  • STATUS_ERROR
  • STATUS_PARAMERROR
  • STATUS_BUFFERTOOSMALL
  • STATUS_MEMORYFAILURE
  • STATUS_ALIGNMENTERROR
  • STATUS_DECODEERROR
  • STATUS_UNIMPLEMENTED

parameters.name: dataIn
parameters.summary: The Titanium.Buffer object containing the data to encrypt

parameters.name: dataInLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes in the dataIn buffer to encrypt. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataIn buffer will be used.

parameters.name: dataOut
parameters.summary:
The Titanium.Buffer object to receive the encrypted data. If this argument is not provided, then the dataIn buffer will be used.

  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to true, then the dataOut buffer will be resized to the size of the encrypted data
  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to false, then ensure that the dataOut buffer is large enough to receive the encrypted data.

parameters.name: dataOutLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes available in the dataOut buffer. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataOut buffer will be used.

returns.summary:
Returns the number of bytes encrypted into the dataOut buffer. If an error occurred, then the return value will be less than zero and will be one of the following values:

  • STATUS_ERROR
  • STATUS_PARAMERROR
  • STATUS_BUFFERTOOSMALL
  • STATUS_MEMORYFAILURE
  • STATUS_ALIGNMENTERROR
  • STATUS_DECODEERROR
  • STATUS_UNIMPLEMENTED

methods.name: finish
methods.summary: Finishes encryption and decryption operations and obtains the final data output.

parameters.name: dataOut
parameters.summary:
The Titanium.Buffer object to receive the output data. If this argument is not provided, then the dataIn buffer will be used.

  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to true, then the dataOut buffer will be resized to the size of the decrypted data
  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to false, then ensure that the dataOut buffer is large enough to receive the decrypted data.

parameters.name: dataOutLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes available in the dataOut buffer. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataOut buffer will be used.

returns.summary:
Returns the number of bytes moved into the dataOut buffer. If an error occurred, then the return value will be less than zero and will be one of the following values:

  • STATUS_ERROR
  • STATUS_PARAMERROR
  • STATUS_BUFFERTOOSMALL
  • STATUS_MEMORYFAILURE
  • STATUS_ALIGNMENTERROR
  • STATUS_DECODEERROR
  • STATUS_UNIMPLEMENTED

methods.name: getOutputLength
methods.summary: getOutputLength is used to determine the output buffer size required to process a given input size.

parameters.name: dataInLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes for the operation

parameters.name: final
parameters.summary: Indicates if the calculation is for determining the output buffer size for a call to final or update. Set to true for final and false for update.

returns.summary: Returns the number of bytes required for the output buffer

methods.name: release
methods.summary: release will dispose of the internal cryptor data

methods.name: reset
methods.summary: reset reinitializes an existing cryptor object with a (possibly) new initialization vector.

parameters.name: initializationVector
parameters.summary: The Titanium.Buffer object containing the initialization vector.

methods.name: update
methods.summary: update is used to encrypt or decrypt data. This method can be called multiple times. The caller does not need to align input data lengths to block sizes; input is buffered as necessary for block ciphers.

parameters.name: dataIn
parameters.summary: The Titanium.Buffer object containing the data to decrypt

parameters.name: dataInLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes in the dataIn buffer to process. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataIn buffer will be used.

parameters.name: dataOut
parameters.summary:
The Titanium.Buffer object to receive the output data. If this argument is not provided, then the dataIn buffer will be used.

  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to true, then the dataOut buffer will be resized to the size of the decrypted data
  • If the resizeBuffer property is set to false, then ensure that the dataOut buffer is large enough to receive the decrypted data.

parameters.name: dataOutLength
parameters.summary: The number of bytes available in the dataOut buffer. If this argument is not provided or is < 0, then the length of the dataOut buffer will be used.

returns.summary:
Returns the number of bytes moved into the dataOut buffer. If an error occurred, then the return value will be less than zero and will be one of the following values:

  • STATUS_ERROR
  • STATUS_PARAMERROR
  • STATUS_BUFFERTOOSMALL
  • STATUS_MEMORYFAILURE
  • STATUS_ALIGNMENTERROR
  • STATUS_DECODEERROR
  • STATUS_UNIMPLEMENTED

properties.name: operation
properties.summary: Used in the capture and parse methods and the success event to specify accepted formats.

properties.name: resizeBuffer
properties.summary: Used in the encrypt, decrypt, update and finish methods. Indicates if the dataOut buffer should be resized to the size needed to hold the result of the operation.
